description: The Nile River is a major river in northeastern Africa that flows through eleven countries. It is a major source of water and life for millions of people.
title: Nile River

description: The Sahara Desert is a vast desert in North Africa that stretches across 11 countries. It covers 9,200,000 square kilometers (3,550,000 sq mi), and it is one of the harshest environments on earth.
title: Sahara Desert

description: The Sahel is a semi-arid region south of the Sahara Desert that stretches across Africa. It is characterized by its savanna climate and its vulnerability to desertification.
title: Sahel

description: The Guinea Corridor is a region in West Africa that includes the coastal countries of Senegal, Guinea, Sierra Leone, Liberia, Ivory Coast, Ghana, Togo, Benin, and Nigeria. It is known for its rich biodiversity and its importance to the transatlantic slave trade.
title: Guinea Corridor

description: The Congo River Basin is a large river basin in Central Africa that is home to a rich biodiversity. It is the second largest river basin in the world, and it is a major source of water for millions of people.
title: Congo River Basin

description: The East Africa Rim is a region in East Africa that includes Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Rwanda, Burundi, and the Democratic Republic of Congo. It is known for its diverse ecosystems and its abundant wildlife.
title: East Africa Rim

description: The Eastern Highlands are a region in East Africa that includes parts of Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Rwanda, and Burundi. They are characterized by their mountainous terrain and their fertile soil.
